DataElement.preferredName: Concurrent Radiation Therapy Prior Cancer Progression Plan Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to radiotherapy being planned along with current therapy prior to progression of cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concurrent Radiation Therapy Prior Cancer Progression Plan
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to radiotherapy being planned along with current therapy prior to progression of cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
